content: We’ll also make forward-looking statements, including demand, product development and capital expenditure plans, production levels, engineering expense, exchange rate impacts, pricing, share repurchases, dividends, future commodity prices, crop production, our supply chain inflation, component deliveries, retail revenue, margins, earnings, cash flow tax rates and other financial metrics. As you can see, industry retail sales in the first quarter of 2022 were actually below last year’s levels in Europe and North America as a result of their restricted production. Industry retail tractor sales in Western Europe, which also restricted by supply chain challenges, decreased by approximately 6% in the first three months of 2022, compared to strong levels in the first quarter of 2021. AGCO’s net sales were about 18%, up compared to the strong first quarter of 2021, excluding the negative impact of currency translation. AGCO’s first quarter net sales in South America grew approximately 42% compared to the first quarter of 2021, excluding favorable currency translation impacts. In North America, higher commodity prices and healthy farm – farmers’ sentiment is expected to result in increased 2022 sales. Your line is open. Your line is open. Your line is open.
